content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
The user wants me to:
1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Pick the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill in the sandbox (.pi/skills/)
4. Write and execute a test to prove it works
5. Send an email to winsorllc@yahoo.com with a progress report

Let me start by exploring the three repositories to understand what's available. I'll need to clone them or use the browser-tools skill to examine them.

First, let me check what skills are already available and understand the current structure. Then I'll explore the repositories.

Let me start by:
1. Checking the current skills structure
2. Cloning/examining the three repositories
3. Finding interesting new ideas
4. Implementing the best one
5. Testing it
6. Sending an email report

I'll use bash to clone the repos and examine them.

content.text: I'll systematically scan the three repositories, find the best new idea, implement it as a skill, test it, and email you a progress report. Let me start by exploring the repositories.

content.thinking: Good, the zeroclaw clone started. Let me continue cloning the other repos in parallel.
